Hello, all.

This post isn't necessarily JUnit related,
but it is very unit=
-testing related.

With our legacy mainframe system,
it is not possible to =
add or
delete data on the fly (ie, from a unit test) -- you have to rely on=
 
nightly batch processes for this.

Since the unit tests can't set up and =
tear down 
their own data, we're running into lots of snags.

Have you all =
encountered similar situations?
How have you worked with or worked around t=
hem?

Thanks for letting me cry on your shoulder,

Erik Ostermueller
